At the end of the 30s, in Austria when the Nazi nightmare was about to introduce in the country, a novice (Julie Andrews) who lives in a convent but can not follow the strict rules of conduct of religious, will work as a governess in home of captain von Trapp (Christopher Plummer), who has seven children, is a widower and educates them as if they were part of a regiment. His arrival dramatically alters the pattern of family, bringing joy back to the home of the Von Trapp family and winning the affection and respect of children. But she ends up falling for the captain, who is committed to a wealthy baroness.
One of the most beloved family films of all time, winner of 5 Oscars, including Best Picture and Director.
